Meta.title: Afilmory - Immersive Darkroom Photo Gallery for Photographers & Brands
Meta.description: Afilmory curates immersive storytelling experiences for photographers, curators and brands.

Hero.titleLine2: Forging focus and memory in the dark
Hero.artistNote: "I bring fragments of daily life into Afilmory, arranging them like a darkroom line. It lets me narrate with light instead of words."

Pillars.title: The four senses behind Afilmory
Pillars.description: Auto Focus, Aperture, Film, Memory - these four words name the system and guide every visitor entering the archive.

items.label: Auto Focus
items.title: Focus
items.description: Sharp focusing locks onto a single breath in the dark, like a pinpoint of light resting on your fingertips - poetry from the first moments.

items.label: Aperture
items.title: Aperture
items.description: Aperture opens gently inside the blackout, shaping brightness while carving emotion so every shadow lands somewhere tangible.

items.label: Film
items.title: Film
items.description: Grain and trailing light weave tactile texture. The slowness and calm of film stay intact here without rushing to reveal.

items.label: Memory
items.title: Memory
items.description: Each shutter is a migration of memory, turning unnamed feelings into chapters that can be reread.

Journey.title: A three-stage journey through the dark corridor
Journey.description: No technical specs required - only light, breathing, and tempo. Each segment mirrors a viewing experience: gathering light, immersion, then presentation.

steps.title: Gathering Light
steps.description: Walk between city and wilderness, capturing humid particles of light while listening to the hush before the shutter.

steps.title: Immersion
steps.description: Arrange work in a darkroom-like interface, pacing it like a gallery wall and muting every excess sound.

steps.title: Presentation
steps.description: Share as a curator so visitors drift along a black corridor and step toward the heart of each story.

GalleryPreview.title: Immersive wall of works (placeholder imagery)
GalleryPreview.description: Before launch, placeholder tiles illustrate the future structure. A sideways scroll echoes a physical hall so light can unfold quietly.

items.title: Misty Morning Glow
items.caption: Riverside light and low clouds spread over a mirrored surface, wrapping the frame in breath.

items.title: Stage Afterglow
items.caption: Heat lingers after stage lights die; faces and silhouettes braid into memory.

items.title: Rainy Night Streets
items.caption: Wet streets mirror neon while grain and contrast combine into a nocturnal score.

ArtistNote.title: A photographer's declaration
ArtistNote.description: "I believe imagery is a slow language. Afilmory lets me collage memories inside a dark interface; controlling aperture is controlling tempo, and the grain of film reminds me to embrace imperfection. Every curation is self-reflection and an invitation for more people to enter the story."
ArtistNote.hintsBody: Imagine yourself in a darkroom lit only by a red safe light. You soak each work like film in chemicals, gently rocking it until an image surfaces. Afilmory's interface carries that slower, light-listening posture onto the screen.
ArtistNote.memoryNote: Darkroom memory placeholder: this area will show real footage later. Abstract textures stand in for now.

ClosingCTA.title: Let images breathe before the world listens
ClosingCTA.description: When you're ready to enter this nightbound gallery, Afilmory quietly accompanies you while you arrange the work - no settings, only memories revealed by light.

Footer.title: Let aperture, film, and memory breathe together
Footer.description: Afilmory crafts immersive showcases for photographers, curators, and brands. A dark corridor replaces noise so stories can be heard.
